Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the potential delay in the development of a COVID-19 vaccine under the Obama administration, stating it would take three years or may not happen at all.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks sufficient evidence or support to back up the assertion that the Obama administration would have taken significantly longer or not developed a COVID-19 vaccine.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the Obama administration would have been less effective or efficient in handling the development of a COVID-19 vaccine compared to the current administration.
Exist alternative explanation: The claim fails to consider alternative explanations for the timeline and development of a COVID-19 vaccine, such as the involvement of multiple factors beyond political rhetoric.
